query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 «S’io ti fiammeggio nel caldo d’amore 2 di là dal modo che ’n terra si vede, 3 sì che del viso tuo vinco il valore,
4 non ti maravigliar, ché ciò procede 5 da perfetto veder, che, come apprende, 6 così nel bene appreso move il piede.
query.result:
1 "If I inflame you with the heat of love 2 beyond the way that is seen on earth, 3 so that I overcome the power of your sight,
4 do not marvel, for this proceeds 5 from perfect seeing, which, as it apprehends, 6 so moves its foot in the apprehended good.

7 I see full well how the eternal light 8 already shines in your intellect, 9 which, seen, alone and always kindles love;
10 and if your love is allured by something else, 11 it is nothing but some trace of that, 12 poorly understood, which shines through here.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Tu vuo’ saper se con altro servigio, 14 per manco voto, si può render tanto 15 che l’anima sicuri di letigio».
query.result: 13 You want to know if with another service, 14 for a lesser vow, one can render so much 15 that the soul is assured of release from conflict."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Sì cominciò Beatrice questo canto; 17 e sì com’ uom che suo parlar non spezza, 18 continüò così ’l processo santo:
19 «Lo maggior don che Dio per sua larghezza 20 fesse creando, e a la sua bontate 21 più conformato, e quel ch’e’ più apprezza,
22 fu de la volontà la libertate; 23 di che le creature intelligenti, 24 e tutte e sole, fuoro e son dotate.
query.result:
16 Thus Beatrice began this song; 17 and like one who does not break off his speech, 18 she continued the holy discourse thus:
19 "The greatest gift that God in his generosity 20 made in creating, and to his goodness 21 most conformed, and that which he most highly values,
22 was the freedom of the will; 23 with which intelligent creatures, 24 and all and only they, were and are endowed.

25 Now it will seem to you, if you reason from this, 26 the high value of the vow, if it is so made 27 that God consents when you consent;
28 for in establishing the pact between God and man, 29 a sacrifice is made of this treasure, 30 just as I say; and it is made with one's own act.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Dunque che render puossi per ristoro? 32 Se credi bene usar quel c’hai offerto, 33 di maltolletto vuo’ far buon lavoro.
query.result: 31 Therefore what can be given in compensation? 32 If you think to make good use of what you have offered, 33 you want to make good work from bad material.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Tu se’ omai del maggior punto certo; 35 ma perché Santa Chiesa in ciò dispensa, 36 che par contra lo ver ch’i’ t’ho scoverto,
37 convienti ancor sedere un poco a mensa, 38 però che ’l cibo rigido c’hai preso, 39 richiede ancora aiuto a tua dispensa.
query.result:
34 You are now certain of the most important point; 35 but because Holy Church grants dispensations in this, 36 which seems contrary to the truth that I have revealed to you,
37 it is fitting that you sit at table for a while longer, 38 because the hard food that you have taken 39 still requires help from your pantry.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Apri la mente a quel ch’io ti paleso 41 e fermalvi entro; ché non fa scïenza, 42 sanza lo ritenere, avere inteso.
query.result: 40 Open your mind to what I reveal to you 41 and fix it within; for without retaining it, 42 having understood is of no use.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Due cose si convegnono a l’essenza 44 di questo sacrificio: l’una è quella 45 di che si fa; l’altr’ è la convenenza.
query.result: 43 Two things are essential 44 to this sacrifice: one is that 45 of which it is made; the other is the agreement.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Quest’ ultima già mai non si cancella 47 se non servata; e intorno di lei 48 sì preciso di sopra si favella:
49 però necessitato fu a li Ebrei 50 pur l’offerere, ancor ch’alcuna offerta 51 sì permutasse, come saver dei.
query.result:
46 This latter is never cancelled 47 if not observed; and concerning it 48 we have spoken so precisely above:
49 therefore the Hebrews were required 50 to offer it, even though some offerings 51 were changed, as you should know.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 L’altra, che per materia t’è aperta, 53 puote ben esser tal, che non si falla 54 se con altra materia si converta.
query.result: 52 The other, which is revealed to you as to its matter, 53 can indeed be such that one does not err 54 if it is converted with another matter.

55 But let no one, of his own accord, shift a burden to his shoulder 56 without the turning 57 of both the white and the yellow key;
58 and consider every exchange foolish, 59 if the thing relinquished is not contained in the thing accepted, 60 as four is contained in six.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Però qualunque cosa tanto pesa 62 per suo valor che tragga ogne bilancia, 63 sodisfar non si può con altra spesa.
query.result: 61 Therefore whatever thing weighs so much 62 by its own value that it tips every scale, 63 cannot be compensated for with any other expense.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Non prendan li mortali il voto a ciancia; 65 siate fedeli, e a ciò far non bieci, 66 come Ieptè a la sua prima mancia;
67 cui più si convenia dicer ‘Mal feci’, 68 che, servando, far peggio; e così stolto 69 ritrovar puoi il gran duca de’ Greci,
70 onde pianse Efigènia il suo bel volto, 71 e fé pianger di sé i folli e i savi 72 ch’udir parlar di così fatto cólto.

Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Siate, Cristiani, a muovervi più gravi: 74 non siate come penna ad ogne vento, 75 e non crediate ch’ogne acqua vi lavi.
query.result: 73 Be slower, Christians, to make vows: 74 do not be like a feather in every wind, 75 and do not believe that every water will wash you clean.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Avete il novo e ’l vecchio Testamento, 77 e ’l pastor de la Chiesa che vi guida; 78 questo vi basti a vostro salvamento.

Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Se mala cupidigia altro vi grida, 80 uomini siate, e non pecore matte, 81 sì che ’l Giudeo di voi tra voi non rida!
82 Non fate com’ agnel che lascia il latte 83 de la sua madre, e semplice e lascivo 84 seco medesmo a suo piacer combatte!».
query.result:
79 If evil desire cries out to you otherwise, 80 be men, and not silly sheep, 81 so that the Jew will not laugh at you among yourselves!
82 Do not be like a lamb that leaves the milk 83 of its mother, and simple and wanton 84 fights with itself at its own pleasure!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Così Beatrice a me com’ ïo scrivo; 86 poi si rivolse tutta disïante 87 a quella parte ove ’l mondo è più vivo.

query.result:
88 Her silence and her changing appearance 89 silenced my eager mind, 90 which already had new questions before it;
91 and just as an arrow that strikes the target 92 before the bowstring is still, 93 so we sped into the second realm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Quivi la donna mia vid’ io sì lieta, 95 come nel lume di quel ciel si mise, 96 che più lucente se ne fé ’l pianeta.
query.result: 94 There I saw my lady so joyful, 95 as she entered the light of that heaven, 96 that the planet became more radiant from it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 E se la stella si cambiò e rise, 98 qual mi fec’ io che pur da mia natura 99 trasmutabile son per tutte guise!
100 Come ’n peschiera ch’è tranquilla e pura 101 traggonsi i pesci a ciò che vien di fori 102 per modo che lo stimin lor pastura,
103 sì vid’ io ben più di mille splendori 104 trarsi ver’ noi, e in ciascun s’udia: 105 «Ecco chi crescerà li nostri amori».
query.result:
97 And if the star changed and smiled, 98 what did I become, who by my very nature 99 am changeable in every way!
100 As in a fishpond that is tranquil and clear 101 the fish are drawn to what comes from outside 102 so that they think it is their food,
103 so I saw well over a thousand splendors 104 drawn towards us, and in each one was heard: 105 "Behold who will increase our love".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 E sì come ciascuno a noi venìa, 107 vedeasi l’ombra piena di letizia 108 nel folgór chiaro che di lei uscia.
query.result: 106 And as each one came towards us, 107 the shade was seen to be full of joy 108 in the bright radiance that issued from it.

109 Imagine, reader, if what begins here 110 did not continue, how you would have 111 an anguished craving for more knowledge;
112 and you will see for yourself how from these 113 I was eager to hear their stories, 114 as they were revealed to my eyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 «O bene nato a cui veder li troni 116 del trïunfo etternal concede grazia 117 prima che la milizia s’abbandoni,
118 del lume che per tutto il ciel si spazia 119 noi semo accesi; e però, se disii 120 di noi chiarirti, a tuo piacer ti sazia».
query.result:
115 "O blessed one to whom grace grants to see the thrones 116 of the eternal triumph 117 before the battle is abandoned,
118 we are kindled with the light that spreads through all heaven; 119 and therefore, if you desire 120 to learn about us, satisfy yourself at your pleasure."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Così da un di quelli spirti pii 122 detto mi fu; e da Beatrice: «Dì, dì 123 sicuramente, e credi come a dii».
query.result: 121 Thus one of those pious spirits 122 spoke to me; and Beatrice: "Speak, speak 123 confidently, and believe them as you would gods."

124 "I see full well how you nest 125 in your own light, and that you draw it from your eyes, 126 because it sparkles as you smile;
127 but I do not know who you are, nor why you have, 128 worthy soul, the rank of the sphere 129 that veils itself from mortals with other rays."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Questo diss’ io diritto a la lumera 131 che pria m’avea parlato; ond’ ella fessi 132 lucente più assai di quel ch’ell’ era.
query.result: 130 I said this directly to the light 131 that had spoken to me first; whereupon it became 132 far more radiant than it was before.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Sì come il sol che si cela elli stessi 134 per troppa luce, come ’l caldo ha róse 135 le temperanze d’i vapori spessi,
136 per più letizia sì mi si nascose 137 dentro al suo raggio la figura santa; 138 e così chiusa chiusa mi rispuose
139 nel modo che ’l seguente canto canta.
query.result:
133 As the sun hides itself 134 through excess of light, when the heat has dispersed 135 the moderation of the dense vapors,
136 so, for greater joy, the holy figure 137 concealed itself from me within its radiance; 138 and thus, completely hidden, it answered me
139 in the manner that the following canto sings.
